Octopuses

28 May 2020 - John Auktopus

The octopus (plural octopuses) is a soft-bodied, eight-limbed mollusc of the order Octopoda.

Around 300 species are recognised, and the order is grouped within the class Cephalopoda with squids, cuttlefish, and nautiloids. Octopuses have a complex nervous system and excellent sight, and are among the most intelligent and behaviourally diverse of all invertebrates.
